name: Abdullah Badawi
description: Tun Abdullah bin Haji Ahmad Badawi (About this sound pronunciation (help·info) ahb-doo-lah ah-mahd bah-dah-wee;[needs IPA] Arabic: عبد الله بن حاجّ أحمد بدوي‎ ʿAbdullāh ibn ḥaajj Aḥmad Badawī; born 26 November 1939) is a Malaysian politician who served as Prime Minister from 2003 to 2009. He was also the President of the United Malays National Organisation (UMNO), the largest political party in Malaysia, and led the governing Barisan Nasional parliamentary coalition. He is informally known as Pak Lah, 'Pak' meaning 'Uncle' while 'Lah' is taken from his name 'Abdullah'. He also called Father of Human Capital Development (Bapa Pembangunan Modal Insan).

name: Abdullah Zaik Abd Rahman
description: Ustaz Abdullah Zaik b Abd Rahman is the President of Malaysian Muslim Solidarity (ISMA) with a mission to ""membina kekuatan keperibadian yang berpaksikan Islam serta penguasaan budaya ilmu, kehidupan sihat, perancangan dan teknologi".

name: Abdul Rahim Bakri
description: Deputy Defence Minister Abdul Rahim Bakri

name: Adnan Yaakob
description: Dato' Seri Haji Adnan bin Haji Yaakob (born April 18, 1950 in Bentong) is a Malaysian politician and the current Menteri Besar of Pahang. He is a member of the United Malays National Organisation (UMNO).

name: Ahmad Maslan
description: Deputy Finance Minister. Member of the Parliament of Malaysia for the Pontian constituency in the State of Johor.

name: Ali Rustam
description: Datuk Seri Haji Mohd Ali bin Mohd Rustam (born 24 August 1949) is a Malaysian politician. He is a member of the United Malays National Organisation (UMNO) and is the ninth Chief Minister of the state of Malacca.

name: Amar Abang Johari
description: Sarawak Minister of Housing & Minister of Tourism

name: Azura Mohd Afandi
description: Johor Baru Puteri Umno chief Azura Mohd Afandi wants the Information Ministry to curb television shows and commercials that could lead people astray from the right religious paths.

name: Badruddin Amiruddin
description: Dato' Paduka Hajji Badruddin bin Amiruldin is a Malay Malaysian politician. He was born in 1951. He is currently the Deputy Permanent Chairman of the United Malays National Organisation (UMNO), the largest Malay political party in the country and the leader of the ruling Barisan Nasional (BN) coalition. Badruddin was also, until his defeat in the March 2008 General Elections, the Member of Parliament for the constituency of Jerai, Kedah in the lower house of Parliament, the Dewan Rakyat.

name: Bung Mokhtar Radin
description: Datuk Buang Mokhtar bin Radin (born 15 September 1959) is a Malaysian politician. He is currently serving as a member of United Malays National Organisation (UMNO) and also Member of the Malaysian Parliament for the constituency of Kinabatangan, Sabah.

name: Hishammuddin Hussein
description: Datuk Seri Panglima Hishammuddin bin Tun Hussein (born 5 August 1961) is a Malaysian politician and member of the United Malays National Organisation (UMNO). He is currently the Minister of Defence and acting Minister of Transport since 16 May 2013.

name: Ibrahim Ali
description: Perkasa President, contemplating future as a taxi driver

name: Idris Jusoh
description: Dato' Seri Idris bin Jusoh (born 15 November 1955) is a Malaysian politician and the current Education and Higher Learning Minister II from May 16, 2013. He was the former Menteri Besar (Chief Minister) for the state of Terengganu and also the Chairman of MARA. He is a member of the United Malays National Organisation (UMNO) which is part of the nation ruling coalition Barisan Nasional.

name: Ikmal Hisham
description:
Ikmal Hisham Bin Abdul Aziz
Negeri:  Tanah Merah
Parlimen:  Kelantan
Parti:  BN - UMNO
Kod Parlimen: P027

name: Ismail Sabri Yaakob
description: Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob, Malaysian politician, is the Minister of Agriculture and Agro-Based Industry. He is a Member of the Parliament of Malaysia for the Bera constituency in Pahang, representing the United Malays National Organisation (UMNO) party in the governing Barisan Nasional coalition. Previously, he held a post as Minister of Domestic Trade, Cooperative and Consumerism.

name: Joseph Kurup
description: Minister in the Prime Minister's Department Tan Sri Joseph Kurup

name: Karpal Singh
description: Karpal Singh s/o Ram Singh was a Malaysian lawyer and politician, who has been the Member of Parliament for the constituency of Bukit Gelugor in the state of Penang since 2004.

name: Khairy Jamaluddin
description: BN Youth Chief, Oxford grad.

name: Khalid Abu Bakar
description: Inspector-General of Police Tan Sri Khalid Abu Bakar

name: Khir Toyo
description: Dr. Mohamed Khir Bin Toyo (born August 6, 1965) was the former Dato' Menteri Besar (Chief Minister) of the state of Selangor in Malaysia from 2000 to 2008. His Barisan Nasional government was defeated at the 2008 general election, following which he served as the state's Opposition Leader until December 2010. He has been a member of the Selangor State Legislative Assembly since 1999, for the seat of Sungai Panjang. He faced charges of corruption after stepping down as Chief Minister, and was convicted of graft in the High Court on 23 December 2011.

name: Lim Guan Eng
description: Penang Chief Minister

name: Malay Consultative Council
description:
The MPM is an umbrella body comprised of 76 Malay NGOs and led by Malay rights group Perkasa.

http://www.themalaysianinsider.com/malaysia/article/malays-reject-nem-perkasa-tells-pm/

name: Malaysian Chinese Association
description: Malaysian Chinese Association (MCA) (simplified Chinese: 马来西亚华人公会; traditional Chinese: 馬來西亞華人公會; Mandarin Pinyin: Mǎláixīyà Huárén Gōnghuì; Jyutping: maa5 loi4 sai1 aa3 waa4 jan4 gung1 wui2; Malay: Persatuan Cina Malaysia) is a uni-racial political party in Malaysia that represents the Malaysian Chinese ethnicity; it is one of the three major component parties of the ruling coalition in Malaysia called the Barisan Nasional (BN) in Malay, or National Front in English.

name: Mohd Noor Abdullah
description: Retired Court of Appeals judge Datuk Mohd Noor Abdullah

name: Mohd Puad Zarkashi
description:
Dr. Mohd Puad Zarkashi is a Malaysian politician and the former Member of Parliament for the Batu Pahat constituency in the State of Johor. He is a member of the United Malay National Organisation (UMNO) party and a Deputy Minister of Education under government of Datuk Seri Najib Tun Razak.

Puad was elected as a Member of Parliament in the 2008 election for the seat of Batu Pahat, previously held by UMNO's Junaidy Abdul Wahab. Puad had previously been a Senator..

name: Muhyiddin Yassin
description: Deputy Prime Minister. Malay First.

name: Najib Razak
description: Prime Minister of Malaysia. Purveyor of RM1 chicken.

name: Namewee
description:
Namewee (Chinese: 黄明志; pinyin: Huáng Míng Zhì)[1] or Wee Meng Chee; (born May 6, 1983 in Muar, Johor)[1][2] is a Malaysian Chinese of Hainanese descent. 

Wee gained popularity after releasing a controversial song fused with the national anthem of Malaysia, Negaraku, which describes what he thinks of the state of the country and its government. The lyrics of the 'remake' shocked the society. In the following weeks, the song increasingly drew both praise and criticism from various quarters of Malaysian society thus been entitled "Muka Ubi Kentang" by the locals.

name: National Fatwa Council
description: "There is a National Fatwa Council that issue fatwas, as part of the Department of Islamic Advancement of Malaysia (JAKIM)."

name: Nawawi Ahmad
description: Dato' Ir. Haji Nawawi bin Haji Ahmad is a Malaysian politician. He is the member of the Parliament of Malaysia for the seat of Langkawi, Kedah.

name: Nazri Abdul Aziz
description: Dato' Seri Mohamed Nazri bin Tan Sri Abdul Aziz is a Malaysian politician from the United Malays National Organisation (UMNO), and is as of 2008 a Minister in the Prime Minister's Department in charge of parliamentary affairs.[1] In June 2005 Nazri caused controversy when he shouted the phrase "racist" (or variants of it) 28 times in Parliament.

name: Nga Kor Ming
description:
Nga Kor Ming (Christian name: David) (Chinese: 倪可敏; pinyin: Ní Kě Mǐn), is a Malaysian politician and is the current Member of Parliament for the seat of Taiping, Perak. He is a member of the Democratic Action Party (DAP) in the Pakatan Rakyat opposition coalition and serves as the party's Assistant National Treasurer.

Nga Kor Ming received a Bachelor of Laws from Universiti Malaya. Before his appointment to the Perak executive council, he practised as a lawyer in Ayer Tawar and also in Ipoh, Perak.

name: Ng Yen Yen
description: Tourist Minister.

name: Parti Islam Se-Malaysia
description: PAS positions itself as a political party that aims to establish Malaysia as a country based on Islamic legal theory derived from the primary sources of Islam, the Quran, Sunnah as well as Hadiths, as opposed to Barisan Nasional's Islam Hadhari, which PAS sees as based on a watered-down understanding of Islam.

name: Ridhuan Tee Abdullah
description: Malaysian academician/intellectual. Possibly bipolar or facing an identity crisis.

name: Rosmah Mansor
description: Our Honorable First Lady of Malaysia

name: Samy Vellu
description: Dato' Seri Samy Vellu Sangalimuthu RIBA (born 8 March 1936 or 20 June 1937, sources differ) is an Indian Malaysian politician. He is the longest serving President of the Malaysian Indian Congress (MIC), a component party of the Barisan Nasional coalition, holding the position since 1979, for 11 consecutive terms. He was the Works Minister of Malaysia and the longest serving minister in the Cabinet of Malaysia until he lost his parliamentary seat in the 2008 general elections.

name: Sharifah Zohra Jabeen
description: Suara Wanita 1Malaysia (SW1M) president Sharifah Zohra Jabeen Syed Shah Miskin

name: Tengku Adnan
description: Datuk Seri Tengku Adnan bin Tengku Mansor is a Malaysian politician. He is the Malaysian Minister of the Federal Territories.

name: Teresa Kok
description: Teresa Kok Suh Sim (Chinese: 郭素沁, born March 31, 1964) is a Malaysian Member of Parliament from the Democratic Action Party (DAP).

name: Tian Chua
description: Chua Tian Chang (born 21 December 1963), better known as Tian Chua (Simplified Chinese;蔡添强 / Traditional Chinese;蔡添强), is a Malaysian politician and is currently the Member of Parliament for the Batu constituency in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.

name: Tony Pua
description: Member of Parliament for Petaling Jaya Utara

name: V. K. Lingam
description: "Sounds like me, looks like me" lawyer

name: Wan Junaidi
description: Deputy Home Minister Datuk Dr Wan Junaidi Tuanku Jaafar

name: Zaid Ibrahim
description: Dato' Mohd Zaid Ibrahim is a prominent Malaysian lawyer turned politician and is a former Minister in the Prime Minister's Department in charge of legal affairs and judicial reform.

name: Zainal Kling
description:
Datuk Prof Dr Zainal Kling adalah Ketua Kluster Sejarah Warisan dan Sosiobudaya Majlis Profesor Negara (MPN) di Malaysia.Beliau adalah pensyarah Universiti Pendidikan Sultan Idris (UPSI), Tanjung Malim,Perak.

Sebagai bekas Dekan Fakulti Sastera dan Sains Sosial Universiti Malaya (UM) dan pemegang Kursi Tun Abdul Ghafar Baba UM berharap pemansuhan PPSMI akan menjayakan konsep 1Malaysia. Beliau adalah AJK Gabungan Persatuan Penulis Nasional yang antara lain mempertikaikan prestasi PPSMI.

name: Zainuddin Maidin
description: Tan Sri Zainuddin Maidin (born in 29 June 1939), is a Malaysian politician and the former Information Minister in the Malaysian cabinet. He is also the former Chief Editor of Utusan Melayu, the most popular Malay language newspaper in Malaysia. In the 12th General Election of Malaysia, he was defeated of the Sungai Petani parliamentary seat by Datuk Johari Abdul from Parti Keadilan Rakyat.

name: Zaiton Mat
description: Datuk Zaiton Mat is the leader of Wanita UMNO Kuantan

name: Zulkifli Noordin
description: Datuk Zulkifli Noordin is a Malaysian politician and a former Member of the Parliament of Malaysia for the Kulim–Bandar Baharu constituency in Kedah. He held his seat as an Independent, having been elected as a member of the People's Justice Party (PKR). He is also the vice president of right-wing Malay organization, Perkasa
